{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's Tanner stage 1 at the age of 17 indicates delayed puberty. The Tanner stage is a measure of physical development in children, adolescents, and adults. Stage 1 is pre-pubertal, which is not normal for a 17-year-old. The inability to smell coffee grounds suggests a disorder of the olfactory system. These symptoms together suggest Kallmann syndrome, which is characterized by delayed or absent puberty and an impaired sense of smell. Kallmann syndrome is caused by isolated gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) deficiency.", "answer_choice": "B. Isolated gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) deficiency"}
